meanings.definition: Having better fortune or success than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She felt luckier than her friend who lost the game.
meanings.sent2: He is luckier than most people in finding four-leaf clovers.
meanings.sent3: The rabbit thought the turtle was luckier because it always won the race.
meanings.sent4: Being luckier than a leprechaun seemed impossible until she found a pot of gold.
meanings.sent5: The luckier he became, the more people wanted to be around him.

meanings.definition: More fortunate or successful than before.
meanings.sent1: After the promotion, she felt luckier than ever.
meanings.sent2: Each day, he grew luckier in his investments.
meanings.sent3: The cat believed knocking over the vase made it luckier.
meanings.sent4: Her garden became luckier with each rainfall, blooming beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The luckier the team got, the more confident they became in their abilities.
